inn1.comm: starts full at off stump, gets forward and nudges into midwicket
gets across his crease and whips a delivery from about middle and off behind square on the leg side
adjusts the line a fraction to outside off, no swing, and punched firmly to cover
that's a lovely stroke, gets onto the front foot and pushes firmly through the line of a full delivery to send it straight of mid-off
drags the length back because of the lack of swing, defended to the covers
short of a length, angled into him, tucked into the leg side so he'll keep the strike
over the wicket, back of a length at off stump, pushed square towards point and there's almost some confusion over the chance of a single but it all ends up okay
fuller, wider outside off, driven towards mid-off without much timing

direct hit! An early wicket for England. Bairstow coming in from cover and gets the under-arm hit. He looks short as the bail pops out of the groove. Sharp work from England. The ball was dropped into the off side and, crucially, Perera had to divert a little to get around the bowler after coming through for the single
short of a length outside off, driven square to point
fuller, straighter, turned into the leg side
short delivery and it is shovelled through square leg to the man on the boundary
defends a length delivery at off stump and runs behind square on the leg side
back of a length, he's across the crease and uses the angle to work into the leg side
full, at the stumps, a punchy straight drive which Willey gets a hand on in his followthrough
back of a length, angled across the right hander, pushed to backward point
gets onto his toes and punches this square into the covers...another dicey bit of running as Roy dives across from point
finds the gap this time, a nice piece of timing as this bisects point and cover, races across the very wide square at The Oval...always a quick outfield
short of a length at off stump, 85mph, defended to the leg side
forced off the back foot into the leg side, wide of mid-on
a flashy stroke, playing off the back foot and it takes a thick top edge, flies well wide of second slip and fine of third man...done a little by some extra bounce
back of a length, nudged towards mid-on, and almost another run out. The communication lines not quite working today
fuller this time, at off stump, 86mph, driven firmly to mid-on
gets it wide of mid-on this time, plenty of bottom hand comes into play as he drives at a full delivery, once again the outfield does plenty of the work as it runs away
back of a length at off stump, 80mph, pushed into the covers
drives this behind square off the back foot down to third man
on middle and off, not a driveable length, defended into the off side
that's a terrific stroke, bunts a full delivery high over the leg side, wide mid-on area, and it goes a couple of bounces for four. Confident shot
full and straight in response, gets forward and defends...gun-barrel straight from Willey today
he's off to flying start, poor delivery this time, full outside leg, and it's a free swing of the arms for Mendis is he flicks it in the air behind square
full outside off, angled across, left alone
back of a length, sliced away off a thickish outside and it runs very quickly to third man - who is Jordan on as a 12th man (for Plunkett)
another lovely piece of timing and placement from Mendis as he drives a back-of-a-length delivery square through the off side
and now he goes straight down the ground, easing forward to a delivery full at off stump and drives it delightfully back past the stumps
pulls the length back a fraction, defended to the off side
a short delivery, neatly played as he just tucks it into the leg side and keeps the strike
angles his first delivery into the pads and gets flicked to deep midwicket
gets across his stumps and flicks this off his pads but straight to short fine leg
angled across outside off, left alone, Buttler can't take it cleanly
this time he beats short fine leg, a neat stroke as he works this off his pads with a little flick of the wrists
full outside off, 91mph, drilled straight to mid-off...looks like he has bust his bat
pushed across outside off, left alone
short of a length, angled into Mendis, worked to the leg side
full outside off, you can see all three stumps behind Gunathilaka as he defends back to Woakes
worked off the stumps out to deep square to bring up Sri Lanka's fifty
full outside off, a flowing drive from Mendis but he finds mid-off
short of a length, worked off his hip to deep square
defends a length delivery back to the bowler
nearly drags on as he tries to force a back-of-a-length delivery, just scoots wide of the stumps
an appeal for lbw as this nips back a touch, but it's quite high and probably going down the leg side
worked behind square on the leg side, short fine-leg can't prevent the single
a bouncer, angled over the leg side, and it's called a wide by Bruce Oxenford
and now he goes very full, at the stumps, 85mph and driven to mid-off
lovely batting, short of a length outside off, he gets onto his toes and drives it square between point and cover. Very classy batting
short of a length, nips back but well played by Mendis as he guides it to backward point and a fumble from Roy allows the single
opens the face and plays to backward point
angled onto the pads, worked through square leg
outside off, pushed to the covers
fuller, tucked into the leg side
short of a length, Gunathilaka tries to flick into the leg side but doesn't make contact
that's well played, gets inside the line of a short delivery and tickles it very of short fine leg who is inside the circle
cracking shot! Power and placement from Mendis. Full outside off, he jumps onto the front foot and drills it through extra cover. Even the sweeper had no hope of stopping it
back of a length, opens the face and it slides wide of the diving Roy at point
outside off, pushed behind square on the off side
short of a length, defended at the top of the bounce and takes his bottom hand off the bat
tucked into the leg side
comes round the wicket, short of a length, dropped down by his feet and he's called through for a single after considerable hesitation
starts full at off stump, defended
superb batting, uses his feet and lofts him over mid-off with a perfectly straight bat...that sends a message to Rashid
drags down a short ball, tucked to the leg side
steps back to cut but just finds cover
fuller delivery, he comes forward and pushes to mid-on
waits for this to turn gently outside off, cuts it through the off side to deep point
gets squared up a little as he aims to work this delivery off his pads and it runs to mid-on
back of a length, straight, good wheels at 91mph, defended to the off side
short, 88mph, Mendis gets comfortably inside the line and tucks into the leg side to keep the strike rotating
round the wicket, short of a length outside off, opens the face wide of backward point and this is a very good piece of running as third man, Moeen Ali, has quite a bit of distance to make up
a bouncer, over middle and leg, and again called wide
fuller outside off, push and run into the covers, and under-arm flick by the fielder running in and almost gives away an overthrow
back of a length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
short outside off and hammered through the covers, wide of the sweeper
short again and this time it's pulled through the leg side, splits the men at deep backward square and deep midwicket
gets it fuller, but it's on leg stump and is tickled behind square
backs away to leg to open up the off side, cuts this off the stumps through the covers
full at leg stump again, a little tickle through fine leg
full at the stumps, driven down to long-off and that takes him to a superb fifty off 44 deliveries
starts with a short ball, is pulled firmly towards midwicket who can't stop it cleanly - Jason Roy in the firing line
round the wicket, tapped into the covers, a well-judged single...very handy to keep the strike rotating
drifts onto leg stump and flicked to deep square
worked off the stumps into midwicket
opens the face and chops this away from outside off through backward point...work for Hales who doesn't seem entirely happy
short and pulled away, picks the gap perfectly out to deep square leg...Sri Lanka rollicking along
full at the stumps, nudged to the leg side
comes out of the front of the hand, dabbed into the off side
full outside off, just a hint of turn, played to backward point
tossed up full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
waits for this outside off and late-cuts but can't beat short third man
that's a magnificent shot from Mendis, he goes slightly inside-out and up-and-over the covers...lovely controlled batting
round the wicket, flicked through square leg
fetched from outside off and bunted along the ground to long-on
very full, dug out down the ground to long-on
nudged down the ground...more milking than a dairy farm
gets a dot ball in as Gunathilaka pats this to the leg side

almost a run out as this is nudged to the off side, Mendis comes racing up the pitch but is sent back and manages to beat the return...he pulled out the dive which Perera didn't bother with. Throw was a bit high, too
short, a scuffed pull, a steepling top-edge, but it lands safe at backward square!
held back in the flight, deflected into the leg side, where Jason Roy slides all over the shop to intercept!

drilled into the covers, sweet shot, and that's a brilliant piece of fielding by a prostrate Plunkett at long-off, who aqua-planes on impact, and drags the ball over the rope regardless! Unlucky, too much surface moisture.
tucked to leg
onto the front foot, stabbed into the covers for another single
outside off, helped into the covers with a waft off the back foot
outside off, skidding off the pitch and straight into an eager back-cut. Tough to grip now for the spinners, as the rain gets a bit heavier ...
onto a good length, and clipped to midwicket
round the wicket, right up to the blockhole, dabbed to cover and more good running
poked back to the bowler
swept from just back of a length, down to backward square
round the wicket to the left-hander, Gunathilaka hangs back in his crease, clips to mid-on and that is an excellently compiled fifty. Well batted sir
up and over! No messing around as Rashid drops a gently turning legbreak onto a length, the batsman gives himself room and wallops way over Moeen's head at mid-off!
retreats to leg again to defend into the leg side, with the spin
good probing length on off stump, Kusal drives but inside edges onto his pads

tossed up, miscued ... caught! Too ambitious, as the bat face opened on impact, and Plunkett in the covers made excellent ground to scoop up a looping chance. The end of a very fine innings from Mendis, probably his best yet in internationals, but he was unlucky with the rain break. Not a lot of time to rediscover his timing with the overs reduction, and he paid the price for rushing against Rashid's accuracy
tapped to cover to get off the mark
well bowled again, channelling the line of middle and leg. Defended
drawn forward, looking for the single but it's not there
chipped on the up to wide mid-on
clipped down to long on, working with the spin
chiselled out towards the point boundary
battered back to the bowler, who stoops in his followthrough and can't quite cling on with his outstretched right hand!
worked into the gap to complete a tight over from Moeen. A good time for the spinners to exert some control as Sri Lanka restart their innings
crushed out to point where Bairstow tumbles gloriously to cut off the four! Dramatic stuff
patted back to the bowler
line and length, dabbed into the covers
worked round the front pad to midwicket
clipped off the pads, short fine leg jogs round to intercept
punched into the covers, excellent control as Sri Lanka settle for the singles
biffed high and handsome! Take that! Chandimal has played a lot of deliveries in this series, and he sees this one well, a stride to meet the length and a batter over cow corner!
dabbed to third man
poked into the covers, a loud bellow of "no!"
round the wicket, working the ball to midwicket
back of a length, met with a poke to short midwicket
fuller length, pumped down to long-on, Moeen recovers well from that first-ball tonking
measured legbreak from just back of a length, short third man slides to gather a controlled edge

tossed up and caught! Gunathilaka looked like he was playing for the googly, giving himself room to lift over the covers. But the legbreak cramped his shot, and Moeen in the covers sauntered round to take the catch
back of a length, this one is the googly, calmly pushed down to long-off
on a good length, pushed back to the bowler
outside off, sliding onto a defensive push to cover
turns from leg to off, but helped past a sprawling short midwicket for another single
tapped back down the track
on the toes, and a very deliberate attempt at a fine glance. But short backward square is alert to field
pushed to cover
very full length, hit on the up to long-on
waved through midwiicket with lively wrists
clipped to leg, another single ticked off
another single, picked off into the gap
worked on the up to long-on
very full, turning into the covers
flipped off the pads, backward square leg tumbles to gather
onto the front foot, pushed to cover
lots of air, a hint of turn as Chandimal waits for it to pitch and pumps it to deep cover
flipped off the toes
back of a length, eased down to long on
flicked fine
worked out to deep midwicket, Bairstow rushes in but can't defend the second run
low full toss but Plunkett at square leg slides well, and flings while on his knees to save the extra run
clipped to leg again as England continue to keep Sri Lanka's ambitions in check
cracked to mid-off
pushed back into the crease and defended
loopy and very full, perfect line, driven off the pitch, but Rashid smothers in his followthrough
too straight this time but Root at backward square cuts it off
thumped to long-off
reverse sweep, can't beat backward point
back of a length, a mow across the line but straight to midwicket
very full, outside off, demanding respect as it is turned to the on side
finds the gap at midwicket this time
thwacked! He's been sizing that up, and that is right out of the middle over deep midwicket. A beautiful echoing wallop
massive wind-up to a rank full-toss, but Mathews gets greedy and skews his swipe off a leading edge!
worked down the ground as Sri Lanka threaten to up the ante...
full and straight, drilled to long-on
back of a length outside leg, Mathews advances then pushes towards mid-off
short of a length, angled to backward point
low full toss which he flicks down the ground to long-on with plenty of bottom hand
flicks this off the pads but can't beat midwicket
tries to give himself room, moves outside leg stump, then pushes towards mid-off for a sharp single...good test of the hamstring
whips a full delivery towards mid-on who is on the edge of the circle
that's a monstrous blow, he couldn't have hit that much better...a crunched, lofted straight drive which ends up the second tier of the pavilion
sensible cricket, pushes through the off side out to deep cover
on the pads, flicked to fine leg
short of a length, gets inside the line and whips to fine leg
comes down the pitch outside leg and flat-bats this to deep cover
back of a length, on a leg-stump line, pushed to the covers
moves across and tries to scoop this from outside leg, doesn't make contact but gets the wide
full at leg stump, driven to deep cover
a yorker, dug out to the off side where Morgan, diving at cover, parries it for a single
slower ball, comes out as a loopy full toss, Mathews can only dab into the off side...but then Roy hurls the ball wide of Buttler for an overthrow. Careless
a flowing straight drive but long-off is able to get around
flicked to midwicket...gets away with the extra ball
short of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
back of a length, flicked into midwicket
charges outside leg to give himself room then misses is attempt to flay through the off side
almost trying to swing too hard here, his bottom hand comes off the bat as he heaves a back-of-a-length ball to mid-on
makes good connection this time, again he's on the charge, outside leg stump, then pulls firmly through midwicket
short outside off, a spliced pull towards mid-on...lands just short of the man coming in. Just five off the over.
full outside off, driven firmly into the pitch and out to cover where Morgan makes a good diving save to his left
slower ball, full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
finds the man at cover again, a well-struck drive...Morgan in the firing line
flipped into the leg side, wide of midwicket, wide of long-on as well but Root makes excellent ground to his right
full outside off, 76mph, driven through the off side...Baristow slides at deep cover, then struggles to get up on a damp outfield
that's clever batting, gets across his crease then flicks a full delivery from around leg stump wide of short fine leg
woah, some extra bounce then, spears into the splice of Mathews' bat and carries a long way in the air towards deeps square
fantastic batting, super way to reach fifty as he upper cuts a short ball over third man for six...using the pace this time
full outside leg stump, 88mph, flicked to deep square leg
low full toss, a slower delivery at 69mph, driven to long-on
full and straight, dug out towards mid-off
plays over the top of a full delivery outside leg stump having given himself room
offers some width outside off, Chandimal flays a lofted cover drive but picks out the sweeper
comes down the pitch then carves a back-of-a-length delivery over the off side, more work for Bairstow at deep cover
swing and a miss at a length ball outside off...he'll feel he's missed out there
a wide yorker, squeezed off the bottom of the bat towards cover
driven out to deep cover
goes for another wide yorker, gets it too wide this time...outside the markers which are to guide the umpire
drives down the ground, doesn't get much timing in the shot as the bat twists in his hands. A good over despite the wide
gets across his stumps then goes down his back knee to try and paddle this away, just flips it towards square leg
flicks a full delivery out to deep midwicket
full at leg stump, a strong bottom-handed flick through midwicket...Bairstow doesn't field cleanly this time
takes leg stump! Trying another sweep, gets across his crease then misses the delivery. Willey on target. Important stand to break (and, again, before three figures)
opens the face to a length delivery and guides to backward point...would have been tight with a direct hit
a loopy slower ball, comes out as a juicy full toss, allows Mathews to flip it over short fine-leg...a shot he was shaping to place regardless of the delivery
short and some width outside off, cut very strong square through the off side and Bairstow has to get his skates on
full, hint of width, swings hard, and edges through the vacant slip cordon
wide yorker, jabbed square into the off side
full outside off, driven down the ground
driven into the off side, Morgan is on the edge of the ring at cover
well bowled, a yorker just outside off, takes the bottom of the bat and dribbles towards cover
full at leg stump, an appeal for lbw as he misses his swing to the leg side...pitched outside leg
excellent from Willey! Gets his yorker in, this time it's dead straight, Prasanna swinging across the line
too much width, and chopped through backward point
punched into the covers
flips a low full toss behind square on the leg side
heaves to the leg side and gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
width outside off this time, a much more convincing shot as he carves it high over backward point
good response, gets his wide yorker in this time, Shanaka plays over the top of it
full and wide outside off again, he does well to get a couple of it as he drives it through point
low full toss this time, he swings very hard but it's just a single to deep cover
pinpoint yorker, straight this time, Mathews can only dig it out for a single
dabs a length ball towards point
back of a length, swings across the line and picks out the man at deep square

he does brilliantly to get a boundary from this, gave himself some room to the leg side then drilled a full ball - not far off the perfect yorker - straight down the ground. Beats long-on coming across. Another fifty for the captain
and now he flips this over his shoulder and over short fine leg...outstanding
three in a row, a really strong finish from the skipper, as he flips a delivery angled into his pads and splits the gap between deep square and deep midwicket
keeps the strike for the final over as he angles a short delivery to third man
ooh, that seems harsh! A wide yorker, but it appeared inside the marker...Mathews left it allow
full outside off, driven into the pitch and straight to Roy at backward point
full outside off again, driven down to long-off and it's just a single
comes down the pitch a couple of steps, it's a low full toss, crunched through the covers...takes Sri Lanka beyond the 300 mark
another wide yorker, jabbed to deep cover
speared very wide outside off, Shanaka reaches for it as he comes down the pitch and it runs to deep cover
finishes full and wide, takes the bottom edge down to third man...excellent skills from Woakes at the end

inn2.comm: outside off, a hint of swing takes it wide, but not too wide. Promising lateral movement...
more lively deviation from a tight line, chunkily defended to mid-on
a nugget of width, and Roy races his bat through the line. Punctured the covers with aplomb, right on the top of the bounce
on the pads, tucked to short midwicket
driven into the covers
an ambtious appeal but Roy was way down the pitch when struck on the pad
pushed into the covers
clipped to leg
on the pads, whisked through square leg to get off the mark
punched on the up to midwicket
back of a length, worked to leg. Moeen biding his time
good line, swinging gently across the left-hander. Pushed back down the pitch
tight line
worked through the gap, into the leg side
drilled on the up, into the covers. Very confident footwork
inswinging, and clipped through backward square
that is just about the worst place to bowl to a front-foot aggressor like Jason Roy. Full, wide, begging to be spanked. And it got what it wanted...
dancing feet, across the crease to meet a hint of width with a firm straight drive
yahoo! Roy wipes something expansive across the line, but almost pulls himself off his feet as the ball ghosts through to the keeper
short-arm pull through square leg, and Roy is quickly calling for two. The wild throw allows him home easily
forward and blocked
nicked. Whoops. Gone. Another Moeen-esque dismissal, shades of Gower when it goes wrong. In the slot, a loose wristy drive, and another elegant edge to the keeper
back of a length, punched off the back foot to mid-off
driven, Root getting a feel for the action

big appeal! And this is being reviewed... An inducker, definitely pad first, and though the ball was going to ghost into the stumps, that was struck outside the line. Was he playing a shot? Debatable... certainly late on it...
forward and defended
nurdled out to square leg where Tharanga slides in the damp
angled into the top of off, met with a firm jab to mid-on
lovely strike, on the up through wide mid-on
patted into the covers
down the pitch and slammed high and hard over the head of mid-off! If he'd scuffed the shot he was a goner. But he utterly nailed it, to a chorus of "Roooot!" from the crowd
over-adjusts, and this one is clipped supremely through square
tighter line, and defended
full and straight, worked to midwicket
tight line to finish the over, recovered well
right behind the line, driven up to mid-on
clipped to deep square leg, good sliding dive limits the damage
keeps a touch low on off stump? Maybe. A slightly exaggerated defensive push to midwicket
worked into the gap at midwicket
into line
fine leg was up but Root's clip can't beat him. He misses out on a boundary there
wafted down the leg-side, England will have that one again
on the back foot, pushed up to mid-on
thumped, high and handsome, way over the rope at long-on!
worked back to the bowler from a full length
whipped from off to leg, but can't beat the field
on the pads, clipped into the gap
clipped to square leg, Maharoof is content to leak singles from his tight line if it stems the boundaries
back of a length, worked on the back foot to mid-on
defended to backward point
clipped to midwicket, very full again
finally, just enough width for Root to free his arms, and he does so with a controlled jab through backward point. Well capitalised
back-to-back boundaries! Forced off the back foot with an open face, and filleting the third man boundary again. So different, yet so similar
tighter and fuller, and ties up the loose end in that over
on the back foot and drilled out to deep cover
defended into the leg side
faint inside edge but the keeper's standing up and there's no cutting that off! Well bowled, tight to off, but you can't defend those ...
pushed on the up to mid-on, good running to rotate the strike
back of a length, tight on off stump, punched into the covers
blocked down to long-on, a single to wrap up the first ten overs
dug in short, pounded off the front foot, at a shin-threatening trajectory back down the pitch! Wallop
clipped to midwicket, Roy calls for two straight away
short, and thumped. Forearms popping as he gets on top of the bounce and pounds another four in front of square
exquisite stroke, eased into the covers with a flowing blade, but well intercepted
wide outside off, jabbed down to third man for Roy's fifty, and it's been a fine agenda-setting innings
short and pulled through square
bang! Too short, a loopy loosener outside off, and Root doesn't miss those, leaning back and lofting over wide mid-on
wide and cut to point. Root is cross with himself for not getting it a yard either side
open face, punched through backward point off the front foot.
short-arm pull through square leg. Not terribly short,  but at that pace it is curtains
wide outside off, wafted down to third man
fuller length, just outside off, dead-batted into the off side and a scampered single completes an expensive over
big appeal, some suspicion from the keeper that there was an edge on that leg-sided delivery, but it is called as wide
big stride, big swing, thwacked like a nine iron, high over long-on!
slower ball, outswing, too much width and Roy meets that with a crashing drive through the covers!
waltzing across the stumps, clipping with an arrow-straight bat through backward square, and up comes the hundred with a volley of boundaries
inside edge through backward square.
fuller length, jabbed to midwicket
full and straight, blocked out to cover with soft hands, and England pinch the single
too short, battered through midwicket. England are cooking
slight wobble from a full length, deflected into the covers
edged, but short! The lack of pace, plus soft hands, means that bounces well short of Chandimal
on the pads, and wafted to leg
short, and slammed through midwicket, but straight to the fielder. That was fizzing
outside off, and swinging away, no contact in an ambitious wipe
full length and punched back to the bowler, good drift on that delivery
driven into the covers, aggressive intent
clipped to midwicket, good length again
floated up outside off stump, met with a full face and guided out to deep point
reverse sweep, and top-edged into space behind point! A bit lucky, but you make your luck
we'll have that one again
open face, half-stopped with a sprawl at point
eased into the leg-side
full face, outswing, and punched down the ground
too short, but that's sharp work at short midwicket to cut off another forceful back-foot push
patted out to point
tip and run, into the covers. The shy comes in but all safely home
very full and well timed to midwicket. There shouldn't have been a run there, but a slight misfield allows the batsmen to cross
into position early for the reverse lap, and connects well
down the leg side, let's have that one again
fully forward, pushed up to mid-on
drilled down the ground, hit well but long-on is in position to intercept
very full, poked in the same direction. Less intent, same result
reverse sweep, and that's drilled out of the meat! Roy marches into the 80s, courtesy of a marginally lax dive at backward point
very full, worked back to the bowler
very slow, round the wicket, on the pads, help yourself. Root does just that, thrashing a sweep through backward square to bring up a brilliant fifty. So quick, yet barely breaking sweat
up to the toes, open face eased down to long-on
blocked with a flourish, back to the bowler
swept again, backward square is on hand this time, but still a poor line, outside leg
thrashed hard and straight, for a one-bounce four, millimetres inside the rope! Power and timing
sloooow out of the hand, held back in the flight, worked gently into space at midwicket
worked out to point
back of a length, spinning in, met with a firm straight bat
clipped hard to deep midwicket. Maharoof can't cut off an easy second
huge appeal but umpire Oxenford isn't having that one. Down the leg side
tapped out to the leg side again
anchored on the back foot, worked up to long-on
forward and clipped to short midwicket
on the back foot, eased out to point
huge appeal, sliding down maybe
worked into the gap again, easy pickings
onto the front foot, defended to cover
forward and worked back up the pitch
short, and slapped dismissively through the leg side. Roy is flying and any straying in length is getting pounded on this pitch
pushed back to the bowler
driven out to deep cover
gets well forward and pushes firmly down the ground
gentle, full delivery, pushed carefully down the ground
uses his feet and drills this with immense power towards mid-off where Mathews flings himself to his right and deflects the ball towards long
another beautifully controlled sweep as he takes this from leg stump backward of square
round the wicket, Roy uses his feet and pushes down the ground
plays across the line a touch and gets a leading edge into the off side
and there's the breakthrough! Root has given that away a bit...goes for the sweep and gets a gentle top edge which loops to short fine leg
goes back to his first ball and pushes to the bowler
finds the bowler again off the back foot
pushed down to long on to open his account
flicked from outside off down the ground
nicely bowled, hint of turn, takes a thick outside edge to short third man
comes down the pitch and flicks to long-on
tucked away off leg stump behind square
a bottom-handed flick through straight midwicket
looks to work to the on side but it runs back down the pitch
eased down the ground to long-off
gets forward and punches to long-on
a heart-in-mouth moment for Roy as his eyes light up a full toss but he almost puts it straight down deep midwicket's throat
a strong sweep from the captain, takes it from outside off to deep square
and there's his hundred! Second of the series. Tucks it off his pads through square leg...a magnificent innings on his home ground. Just 74 balls.
worked off his pads again through the leg side
down the pitch, actually ends up yorking himself, just manages to drive it past the bowler
worked into midwicket
gets forward and simply nudges a length ball to long-on
huge appeal for lbw as Morgan missed a reverse sweep...Chandimal was jumping. Ah, think it took the glove
punches through midwicket with a straight bat
magnificent strike...been a few overs without a boundary but now he uses his feet and lofts this wonderfully straight down the ground into the pavilion
driven firmly to cover
uses his feet, Gunathilaka drags the length back and Morgan can't make contact. Just takes pad
gives himself room to the leg side, picks out cover again as he cuts...just a bit of pressure building on Morgan
another dot ball as he plays back to the bowler
dragged down short, pulled just wide of long-on and they scamper hard to make the second
drives and gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg...good over
gets across his crease and takes a ball from outside off to long-on
that will help Morgan! A full ball outside off and he deposits it clean over long-off with a strong lofted drive (think he'd just changed his bat before this over)
comes round the wicket, width outside off, chopped to third man
short of a length on leg stumps, worked off the pads to long leg...200 on the board
uses his feet, it's short of a length, he dabs it towards backward point
punches a length delivery down the ground
gets away with it! Roy's day...he comes charging down the pitch, carves it high into the air on the off side but it falls between two fielders, one running back and the other running in
back to a more controlled shot, worked off his pads to deep square
pushes this from around off stump down to long-on
moves way outside leg stump then slaps this down the ground, didn't quite get his timing
tossed up, more air this time, driven to long-off
tucked away from outside leg to deep midwicket
full outside off, Roy walks into his drive and finds cover
length ball outside off, swung down the ground off the toe end
full and straight, worked along the ground through midwicket
a slower ball, full and straight, flicked into the leg side
short of a length, late cut to short third man and Roy is quickly out of the blocks to make the single
short of a length, shovelled out to deep midwicket
moves to the leg side, the bowler follows him, clipped sweetly off the pads and into the gap

good delivery, a yorker, but Roy has done superbly well to dig this out through the leg side...places it well enough for a second, then gets a third because of a fumble by Mendis. A good ball goes for three. Ouch.
drives down to long-off
moving outside leg stump again, a bottom-handed flick down the ground
full outside off, steered towards backward point and that's a very good piece of fielding to prevent a run. Need more of that

what a catch! A stunning grab. Will that spark Sri Lanka? Gunathilaka - who pulled off the good stop the ball before - has pulled off a screaming catch, full length to his right at backward point...he was horizontal when he took the catch. It was a short, wide ball. Morgan nailed his cut shot. But it was within Gunathilaka's grasp
worked off the pads to deep square
works a length ball into the leg side and scampers to get off the mark
nearly another! Luck is on Roy's side again. Slices a drive in the air towards deep cover but it doesn't quite reach the man running in
flies off the edge...short of short third man! Roy just needs to be careful here
more controlled this time as he takes it from outside off along the ground to deep midwicket
full and straight, driven to mid-on
full and straight, driven firmly down the ground...lot of effort for a single
good delivery, full and straight, knocked to mid-on for a well-judged single
moves to the leg side and drives a slower ball down the ground
short of a length, flipped to midwicket...good fielding. Roy was racing down the pitch was able to get back
tight with a hit! Push straight at mid-off and Bairstow was off immediately...actually, he would have made it. Good pace

dropped!, Roy spoons one back at Lakmal, to his right as he veers off the pitch, but it wasn't one of the toughest you'll see. And then the ball almost rebounded into the stumps with Bairstow out of his ground
goes way across his crease and works a wide delivery from outside off down the ground on the on side...makes it into a brace
goes for a reverse sweep, doesn't make contact and it's an excellent take by Chandimal
nudges a length ball through the leg side, but fantastic placement as he splits the men at long-on and deep midwicket
gets right across his crease and then sweeps, the ball trickles behind square
full at off stump, pushed firmly past Mathews at cover and to the left of mid-off
heaves a delivery from outside off down to long on
low full toss which he swings through midwicket, not out of the middle, but again the pace of these two between the wickets makes it a couple
that's a crunching shot! Phew, what power. Short of a length and Roy latches on with a front-foot pull through midwicket
a slower ball, dragged down, Roy is almost through his shot but manages to paddle the ball to deep square
back of a length, pushed down to long-on
another slower ball/cutter, dragged down short, clubbed to long-on
flicked off the pads, finds the gap behind square on the leg side...no catching that on this outfield
walks across his crease and, once again, places it wide of long-on so he can come back for the second which takes him to 150 off 109 balls. What an innings
dabbed to short third man
back of a length, flicked down the ground
right across his crease again, goes to flick away a full delivery and gets smack on the foot...bit of pain for Roy
pushed back to the bowler
punched with a straight bat down the ground
angled into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
a streaky shot which evades the fielder, he charges down the pitch, swings to the leg side, and the outside edge loops over short third man
flaps a length ball down the leg side...still hobbling a bit after that blow to the foot
drives a full delivery sweetly down the ground
heaves a back-of-a-length ball through square leg...no chance of making that a second at the moment for Roy
back of a length, angled into the pads, deflects down by his feet and Roy still aware enough to call him through
what a shot...uses his feet then creams a skimming cover drive over the infield, wide of long-off
dragged way down the leg side, that's a big wide
driven through the covers to the sweeper
goes back and nudges this off his pads behind square
cut firmly and finds cover
angled into the pads, worked out to deep midwicket and the speed of these two between wickets - especially Roy with the time he's been out there and the blow to the foot - is impressive
comes forward, gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
full at middle and leg, bunted down the ground
whipped off his toes to deep midwicket and, again, they run the fielders ragged
moves outside leg and eases this full delivery straight down the ground
width outside off, cut through point and the sweeper does well to keep it to a single
no record for Roy! Moving to the leg side, he loses his shape on a heave across the line, defeated by a slower ball so a good piece of bowling as well
tucks his first ball off his hip to long leg
works a length ball down the ground and they decide to stay at one
worked into the leg side
that's Buttler's reply to Maharoof, he brings out the scoop over his shoulder but long leg is able to get around
steps to the leg side and hammers a length delivery through the off side, deep point makes a meal of cutting that off and allows a second...which they may have got anyway, to be fair
finds the gap this time, carves a length delivery over backward point and no chance for the sweeper on this occasion
did this carry?! Sliced off a thick outside edge towards short third man. Was a very low catch if it was a chance
angled into the pads, deflects off the thigh guard fine past the keeper
short ball outside off stump, he goes for the pull and was done for a lack of pace...through his stroke
full, straight, hammered...down the ground, out of reach of mid-on. Dismissive.
slower ball outside off, think he gets a bottom edge as he goes to play square into the off side...doesn't carry to Chandimal
another short ball and this one is crunched through square leg as he pulls powerfully
short ball, very short, called wide
a slower ball, full, driven wide of long-off - Lakmal - who just about manages to haul his body around the boundary
there it is! Buttler wins it in style, comes down the pitch and clubs it over wide mid-on
